intro: Anemonospermos aspera, commonly known as the rough anemonosperma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anemonaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Anemonospermos aspera is often found in moist, forested areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
